comment.author: 72304760@N00
comment._content: I met Annie's sister Susan ( who lives in Berkeley)  when she did a communtity garden with her assemblage art right outside my windows in Oakland. Susan and I were also in a show together at SFMOMA's Rental (now Artists') Gallery.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Podcast of this Gallery Talk has been posted: www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/annie_leibovitz/audio.php

comment.author: 11746524@N03
comment._content: The "talk" that Mrs. O'Connor gives at the Brooklyn Museum Podcast reflects how she is true to the company that employs her. The talk is vane, full of celebrity gossip but when she is asked a very simple question (what camera does she [Leibovitz] uses?) the answer is "I don't know". Mrs. O'Connor fails to address even a hint of critique to Mrs. Leibovitz work and certainly not an artistic nor an academic reference is given to approach Mrs. Leibovitz's photographies. Truly disappointing talk. Don't even bother listening unless you enjoy the petty-gossip and the repetition of common places.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
Thanks for the crit, cronopiable.  The great thing about cross posting to Flickr is the ability to hear comments.  Many thanks,  

Shelley, Chief of Technology, Brooklyn Museum
